goals.title: Goals & Organization
goals.description: Our mission is organized around clear objectives and coordinated international action.

items.title: Maritime Flotilla
items.description: Coordinate 1000 ships from multiple nations to converge and sail together toward Gaza, creating an unprecedented peaceful maritime demonstration.

items.title: Break the Blockade
items.description: Challenge the illegal blockade through peaceful resistance, bringing international attention to the humanitarian crisis and demanding open borders.

items.title: Global Unity
items.description: Build an international coalition of civil society organizations, activists, and supporters committed to justice and human rights.

pressRelease.title: Official Press Release
pressRelease.subtitle: Freedom Flotilla Coalition & Thousand Madleens to Gaza Unite

keyMessages: We sail because silence is betrayal
We sail because Gaza must live
We sail because Palestine must be free

sections.title: Two initiatives, one flotilla, one mission
sections.content: The Freedom Flotilla Coalition (FFC) and Thousand Madleens to Gaza (TMTG) are joining forces as one flotilla to challenge Israel's illegal and deadly siege of Gaza. This alliance unites two global, people-led initiatives in a shared commitment to justice and solidarity with the Palestinian people.

On September 24th, 2025, we will launch the next wave of civilian ships to Gaza from Catania following the first boats of the Global Sumud Flotilla now en route to Palestine's shores. It continues a legacy of resistance that began with the Free Gaza Movement in 2008 and FFC's missions since 2010. We sail because world powers enable Israel's illegal siege. We sail to break it, to defy complicity, and to affirm the rights of Palestinians in Gaza.

sections.title: Why this alliance matters
sections.content: This partnership is rooted in years of experience and grassroots organizing. By consolidating maritime safety, legal defence, and communications, we strengthen coordination, safety, messaging, and global impact to confront what governments, corporations and institutions have abandonedâ€”to stop genocide, resist apartheid and demand accountability under international law. We sail because silence is betrayal. We sail because Gaza must live. We sail because Palestine must be free!

sections.title: Why now
sections.content: Israel's illegal siege of Gaza is both a humanitarian emergency and a political crime. Gaza is being annihilated, and her people deliberately starved, bombed, and erased by Israel and their allies. Children are dying of hunger and disease, denied food, clean water, medicine, and the basic right to live with dignity.

Since October 2023, Israel's genocidal assault has turned an already suffocating illegal blockade into a catastrophe. Yet our governments continue to arm, fund, and profit from this horror. We cannot wait for permission. We cannot wait for leaders who have chosen complicity over humanity. The urgency demands not one ship, but waves of ships.

Israel's recent armed attacks on the FFC's vesselsâ€”Conscience, Madleen, and Handalaâ€”ignited a worldwide response. Dozens of boats from across the globe have since joined the Global Sumud Flotilla, proving that the demand to break Israel's illegal siege on Gaza cannot be silenced or deterred.

announcement.callToAction: We invite media to attend our launch event in Catania prior to the launch date to give ample time for interviews. Please contact media@freedomflotilla.org or thousand.madleens@proton.me
announcement.title: Freedom Flotilla Coalition & Thousand Madleens to Gaza unite to sail for Gaza on September 24th
announcement.description: Two initiatives, one flotilla, one mission. The Freedom Flotilla Coalition (FFC) and Thousand Madleens to Gaza (TMTG) are joining forces as one flotilla to challenge Israel's illegal and deadly siege of Gaza.

site.title: Thousand Madleens to Gaza UK Delegation
site.description: Breaking the blockade through peaceful solidarity and international cooperation.
site.campaignMessage: Join the historic #1000MadleensToGaza flotilla! ðŸš¢ Breaking the blockade through peaceful solidarity. Together we sail for justice and human rights. #FreePalestine #BreakTheBlockade

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: A tribute to the resilience and patience of the people of Gaza, and a collective movement to stand alongside them.

cards.title: Tribute to Resilience
cards.description: The "Madleen" represents the unwavering spirit of the Palestinians who refuse to accept injustice. Our campaign honors the courage of all who have sailed these waters before us, carrying hope across the Mediterranean.

cards.title: Global Solidarity
cards.description: From every corner of the world, we unite in peaceful resistance. 1000 ships from many nations will converge to break the Israeli genocidal blockade through the power of international civil society.

news.title: Latest News
news.description: Stay updated with the latest developments in our mission to Gaza

articles.title: Gaza-Bound Flotilla Grows to 40 Vessels After Joining Sicilian Group
articles.description: The Global Sumud Flotilla expands dramatically as vessels from Spain merge with Sicilian contingent, creating an armada of 40 ships now 1,000 miles from Gaza. Despite facing drone threats and challenging conditions, the international fleet remains determined to break the blockade.

articles.title: Freedom Flotilla Coalition & Thousand Madleens to Gaza Unite for September 24th Launch
articles.description: Historic alliance announced as FFC and TMTG join forces for a unified flotilla launching September 24th, 2025 from Catania. Two global initiatives unite with one mission: to challenge Israel's illegal siege of Gaza through coordinated maritime resistance.

articles.title: THE 1000 FLOTILLA INITIATIVE TO BREAK THE SIEGE
articles.description: A comprehensive look at the ambitious campaign to organize 1000 ships from around the world in solidarity with Gaza, breaking the blockade through peaceful maritime resistance.

articles.title: A Thousand Madleens: New Civilian Fleet Readies to Defy Israeli Blockade
articles.description: International civil society prepares an unprecedented maritime flotilla as civilians worldwide unite to challenge the blockade of Gaza through coordinated peaceful action.

articles.title: Swindon Fete to Fund Aid Volunteer's Gaza Flotilla Journey
articles.description: A summer fete by Swindon Palestine Solidarity aims to raise funds for volunteer Liaquth Ali's participation in the 'A Thousand Madleens to Gaza' flotilla, featuring family-friendly activities and cultural events.

articles.title: Flotilla for Palestine: Support Center for Gaza Opens in Nice
articles.description: Thousand Madleens Nice opens its doors as a support center following the return of the Madleen crew and Soumoud caravan, establishing a base for raising awareness about the Gaza flotilla movement.

articles.title: 'Thousand Ship Flotilla' Announced to Challenge Israel's Gaza Blockade
articles.description: Malaysian civil society coalition led by MAPIM announces the largest maritime mobilization of its kind, aiming to send vessels from across the globe carrying humanitarian aid to Gaza in defiance of Israel's naval embargo.

articles.title: 8 US Veterans Join Gaza-Bound Flotilla in Protest of Complicity in Israel's Genocidal War
articles.description: Eight US military veterans have joined the Global Sumud Flotilla in a powerful act of conscience, defying the same war machine they once served. Their participation highlights growing American opposition to US complicity in Israel's war on Gaza, as they sail with a clear message: 'End genocide, end complicity, and free Palestine.'

articles.title: 13th Maghreb Sumud Flotilla Ship Sets Sail from Tunisia Toward Gaza
articles.description: The 13th ship from the Maghreb Sumud Flotilla departed Gammarth port north of Tunis as part of the larger Global Sumud Flotilla. With dozens of Tunisians gathered to see it off, the vessel joins 12 other ships already en route to Gaza, while Greek vessels prepare to unite with the solidarity fleet challenging Israel's 18-year blockade.

socialMedia.title: Follow Our Journey
socialMedia.description: Stay updated with the latest news and campaign progress across all our social platforms.

backgroundImage.alt: Sailboat with Palestinian flag sailing on the Mediterranean Sea - Thousand Madleens to Gaza campaign

hero.title: Thousand Madleens to Gaza UK Delegation
hero.subtitle: Breaking the Israeli Blockade
hero.description: A global maritime flotilla campaign to break the blockade of Gaza through peaceful solidarity. Inspired by resilience, driven by hope, united in action.

footer.description: Breaking the blockade through peaceful solidarity and international cooperation.

copyright.text: 1000 Madleens to Gaza Campaign. All rights reserved.

points.title: Peaceful Mission
points.description: The 1000 Madleens to Gaza campaign is committed to peaceful, non-violent resistance. All participants must agree to strict non-violence protocols.

points.title: Legal Risks
points.description: Participants should be aware that this mission may involve legal risks, including potential detention or legal proceedings. We recommend consulting with legal counsel before participating.

points.title: Safety First
points.description: Maritime operations carry inherent risks. All vessels must meet safety standards, and participants must have appropriate maritime experience or training.

points.title: International Law
points.description: This campaign operates within the framework of international maritime law and the principles of civil disobedience in challenging what we consider to be violations of international law.

points.title: Independent Participation
points.description: Participation in this campaign is voluntary and at your own risk. The campaign organizers cannot be held responsible for individual decisions or consequences.
